project_name: Grand River Bridge and Habitat Enhancement Project
project_description: Construction of a new bridge over the Grand River, including the creation of overwintering pools, bank remediation, and habitat diversification features.
authorized_activities: Construction of a new bridge with piers and associated structures
Installation of habitat diversification and enhancement features
authorized_activities_description: The authorized activities include the construction of a new bridge with piers and associated structures, the creation of overwintering pool habitat, bank remediation and rehabilitation, and the installation of habitat diversification and enhancement features. These activities are designed to mitigate the impact of the bridge construction on fish habitat and to enhance the river ecosystem.
project_contact: John Smith, Project Manager, Grand River Development Corporation
project_budget_funding_source_details: The project is funded by a combination of federal and provincial government grants, with the majority of the funding coming from the federal government.
project_budget_funding_source_percentage: 70% federal, 30% provincial
Federal government provides 70% of the funding, while the provincial government provides the remaining 30%.
